formula: Multiplicative with a(2^e)=2^e, a(p^e)=p^(e-(e mod 2)) if p mod 4=3, a(p^e)=((p-1)*e+p)*p^(e-1) if p mod 4<>3 and p<>2. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Sep 22 2003
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = Module[{f, p, e}, f = FactorInteger[n]; Switch[f, {{2, _}}, Return[n], {{_, _}}, {p, e} = f[[1]]; If[Mod[p, 4] == 3, Return[p^(e - Mod[e, 2])], Return[((p-1)*e+p)*p^(e-1)]], _, Times @@ (a[#[[1]]^#[[2]]]& /@ f)]];
program: a(n)=my(o=valuation(n,2),f=factor(n>>o)); prod(i=1,#f~, ap(f[i,1],f[i,2]))<<o \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Dec 06 2016
